intro: Cyclamen colchicum, commonly known as the Persian cyclamen, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters, with a compact, bushy appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Cyclamen colchicum is also known for its medicinal properties, with some parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
